Books.title: The Alchemist
Books.author: Paulo Coelho
Books.description: The Alchemist is a novel by Brazilian author Paulo Coelho that was first published in 1988. The story follows Santiago, a shepherd boy who dreams of discovering treasure in the pyramids of Egypt. Along the way, he meets a series of colorful characters who teach him important life lessons.

Books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
Books.author: J.D. Salinger
Books.description: The Catcher in the Rye is a novel by J.D. Salinger that was first published in 1951. The story is told from the perspective of Holden Caulfield, a teenage boy who has been expelled from his prep school. As he wanders around New York City, he struggles with the concept of adulthood and the phoniness he sees in the world around him.

Books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Books.author: Harper Lee
Books.description: To Kill a Mockingbird is a novel by Harper Lee that was first published in 1960. The story is set in the Deep South and follows Scout Finch, a young girl who watches her father, a lawyer, defend a black man accused of rape. Through her experiences, Scout learns about racism and prejudice.

Books.author: George Orwell
Books.description: 1984 is a dystopian novel by George Orwell that was first published in 1949. The story is set in a totalitarian society where the government has complete control over every aspect of people's lives. The protagonist, Winston Smith, works for the government and begins to rebel against the system.

Books.title: The Great Gatsby
Books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Books.description: The Great Gatsby is a novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald that was first published in 1925. The story is set in the Roaring Twenties and follows Jay Gatsby, a wealthy socialite who is in love with Daisy Buchanan. The novel explores themes of love, wealth, and the corruption of the American Dream.

Books.title: Pride and Prejudice
Books.author: Jane Austen
Books.description: Pride and Prejudice is a romantic novel of manners written by Jane Austen in 1813. The novel follows the character development of Elizabeth Bennet, the dynamic protagonist of the book who learns about the repercussions of hasty judgments and comes to appreciate the difference between superficial goodness and actual goodness.

Books.title: Beloved
Books.author: Toni Morrison
Books.description: Beloved is a novel by Toni Morrison published in 1987. The novel tells the story of Sethe, an African-American woman who escapes slavery and lives with her daughter in Ohio. The story is based on the true story of Margaret Garner, a slave who escaped slavery in Kentucky in 1856 and fled to Ohio.

Books.title: The Hobbit
Books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Books.description: The Hobbit is a novel by J.R.R. Tolkien published in 1937. It is a children's book that has become popular with adults. The story is about a hobbit named Bilbo Baggins who is recruited by a wizard named Gandalf to help a group of dwarves reclaim their treasure from a dragon. Along the way, they encounter trolls, goblins, giant spiders, and a mysterious creature named Gollum. The novel has been praised for its world-building and character development.

Books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
Books.author: Oscar Wilde
Books.description: The Picture of Dorian Gray is a novel by Oscar Wilde published in 1890. It is a Gothic horror novel that explores the themes of beauty, youth, and morality. The story is about a young man named Dorian Gray who has his portrait painted by an artist named Basil Hallward. Dorian becomes obsessed with his own beauty and begins a life of hedonism and debauchery. The portrait, however, ages and shows the physical and moral decay that Dorian refuses to acknowledge.

Books.title: The Hunger Games
Books.author: Suzanne Collins
Books.description: In the ruins of a place once known as North America lies the nation of Panem, a shining Capitol surrounded by twelve outlying districts. The Capitol is harsh and cruel and keeps the districts in line by forcing them all to send one boy and one girl between the ages of twelve and eighteen to participate in the annual Hunger Games, a fight to the death on live TV.

Books.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
Books.author: Stieg Larsson
Books.description: Forty years ago, Harriet Vanger disappeared from a family gathering on the island owned and inhabited by the powerful Vanger clan. Her body was never found, yet her uncle is convinced it was murder - and that the killer is a member of his own tightly knit but dysfunctional family. He employs disgraced financial journalist Mikael Blomkvist and the tattooed, truculent computer hacker Lisbeth Salander to investigate.

Books.title: Gone Girl
Books.author: Gillian Flynn
Books.description: On a warm summer morning in North Carthage, Missouri, it is Nick and Amy Dunne's fifth wedding anniversary. Presents are being wrapped and reservations are being made when Nick's clever and beautiful wife disappears. Husband-of-the-Year Nick isn't doing himself any favors with cringe-worthy daydreams about the slope and shape of his wife's head, but passages from Amy's diary reveal the alpha-girl perfectionist could have put anyone dangerously on edge. Under mounting pressure from the police and the media—as well as Amy's fiercely doting parents—the town golden boy parades an endless series of lies, deceits, and inappropriate behavior. Nick is oddly evasive, and he's definitely bitter—but is he really a killer?

Books.title: The Fault in Our Stars
Books.author: John Green
Books.description: Despite the tumor-shrinking medical miracle that has bought her a few years, Hazel has never been anything but terminal, her final chapter inscribed upon diagnosis. But when a gorgeous plot twist named Augustus Waters suddenly appears at Cancer Kid Support Group, Hazel's story is about to be completely rewritten.

Books.title: The Testaments
Books.author: Margaret Atwood
Books.description: The Testaments is a novel by Margaret Atwood that was first published in 2019. The story is set 15 years after the events of The Handmaid's Tale and follows three women who are involved in the Gilead regime: Aunt Lydia, a powerful figure within the regime; Agnes, a young girl who has grown up in Gilead; and Daisy, a young woman living in Canada who learns about her true identity and connection to Gilead.

Books.title: Hamnet
Books.author: Maggie O'Farrell
Books.description: Hamnet is a luminous portrait of a marriage, a shattering evocation of a family ravaged by grief and loss, and a hypnotic recreation of the story that inspired one of the greatest literary masterpieces of all time. On a summer's day in 1596, a young girl in Stratford-upon-Avon takes to her bed with a fever. Her twin brother, Hamnet, searches everywhere for help. Why is nobody at home? Their mother, Agnes, is over a mile away, in the garden where she grows medicinal herbs. Their father is working in London. Neither parent knows that one of the children will not survive the week.

Books.title: The Nightingale
Books.author: Kristin Hannah
Books.description: The Nightingale is a novel that tells the story of two sisters in France during World War II. Vianne is forced to house a German soldier, while Isabelle joins the resistance. The book explores themes of war, family, love, and sacrifice.

Books.title: Little Fires Everywhere
Books.author: Celeste Ng
Books.description: Little Fires Everywhere is a novel that explores family dynamics, motherhood, and race in suburban America. The story centers around two families, the Richardsons and the Warrens, and their intersecting lives in Shaker Heights, Ohio.

Books.title: The Water Dancer
Books.author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
Books.description: The Water Dancer is a novel that tells the story of Hiram Walker, a young slave with a photographic memory, who discovers he has a supernatural power. He embarks on a journey to escape slavery and find freedom.

Books.title: Educated
Books.author: Tara Westover
Books.description: Educated is a memoir that tells the story of Tara Westover's upbringing in a Mormon family in rural Idaho. She was not allowed to attend school and worked in her father's junkyard. She taught herself enough to take the ACT and eventually earned a Ph.D.

Books.title: An American Marriage
Books.author: Tayari Jones
Books.description: An American Marriage is a novel that explores the impact of wrongful incarceration on a young African American couple. The book deals with themes of love, marriage, loyalty, and social justice.
